title: Audio-Plane: Audio Factorization Plane Gaussian Splatting for Real-Time Talking Head Synthesis
author: Shuai Shen (Nanyang Technological University), Wanhua Li (Harvard University), Yunpeng Zhang (PhiGent Robotics), Weipeng Hu (Nanyang Technological University), Yap-Peng Tan (Nanyang Technological University), ...
relevance_why: This paper presents a method for synthesizing talking heads that can be useful for various audio-visual applications, potentially informing approaches in speech synthesis, audio restorations, and multimodal generation.
background: The task involves generating realistic talking head videos that synchronize animated facial expressions with corresponding audio inputs.
contribution: This paper introduces the Audio Factorization Plane to solve the challenge of dynamic talking head synthesis, achieving high fidelity and real-time image generation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods in talking head synthesis often struggle with balancing visual quality and computational efficiency, requiring substantial resources for dynamic facial modeling.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances Gaussian Splatting with a compact audio-driven dynamic representation, significantly improving generation speed and visual realism.

key_innovation: The method utilizes a novel Audio Factorization Plane that decomposes audio and spatial features, integrating them to improve facial motion modeling while maintaining efficiency.
real_world_impact: This technique can transform applications in film production, virtual avatars, and remote communication, providing a foundation for realistic and responsive talking head generation. No immediate real-world impact.
limitations: While not explicitly mentioned, the general complexity of real-time applications and synchronization challenges could pose limitations.

new_terms.Gaussian Splatting: **Gaussian Splatting** is a rendering technique that represents scenes using point clouds modeled by Gaussian distributions to enable efficient volumetric rendering.
new_terms.Audio Factorization Plane: **Audio Factorization Plane** refers to a method of decomposing audio-driven volumetric data into distinct spatial planes to enhance dynamic modeling of visual representations.

open_sourcing: Synthesized results are available at https://sstzal.github.io/Audio-Plane/
